item.title: Report X-2025020445
item.description:
Report X-2025020445

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unload managers noticed that a plastic bubble-mailer envelope recently placed on the IC belt in the unload was smoking. A manager ripped it open and found that the package contained six boxes of safety matches. One of the boxes had caught on fire. The manager blew out the fire and alerted the DG Nav specialist, who was in the middle of processing hazmats. DG Nav specialist isolated the damaged package on a metal rack where it could not spread fire if it were to catch on fire again. The matches in the one box appear to be mostly or fully "used" given the burnt appearance. The other five boxes are in acceptable condition.

item.title: Report E-2025020131
item.description:
Report E-2025020131

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: MARBLE FALLS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 10, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3267 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizers and absorbents to remediate the site. All waste and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

Report X-2025020497

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-08
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A ONE GALLON COLEMAN BEVERAGE COOLER DUE TO BEING VERY COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 0.5 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A PLASTIC VACUUMED SEALED BAG OF AN UNKNOWN MATERIAL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE SHIPPER INFORMATION ON THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DOES NOT HAVE A FULL SHIPPER ADDRESS VISIBLE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X837V1, OMH, 1035 CONGER ST, EUGENE OR 97402-6938. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:
Report E-2025020103

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. The crew transferred the contents into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 11, 2025, at 1540 ET, Landstar Inway personnel contacted ERTS regarding the presence of residue of a sodium hydroxide solution released from a plastic tote, impacting the trailer floor only. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors used a citric acid solution to neutralize the area before confirming with pH testing. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gal poly drum which was transported offsite by contractors pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025020443
item.description:
Report X-2025020443

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP PROCESSING AREA IN SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER SAW WAS A PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE 8 AND OXIDIZER 5.1 LABELS. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR BOTH. ADDED SILVER SHIELD LINERS TO INSIDE OF GLOVES. SOLIDIFIED LIQUIDS WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND THEN TESTED WITH PH TAPE. WAS NOT WITHIN 6-9 RANGE SO ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE TILL MIXTURE WAS NOT AN ALKALINE OR BASE. READ WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. AFTER PROCESSING, REFERRED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

item.description:
Report E-2025020167

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a smoking and leaking tote containing hazardous material, Ethylenediamine. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-ounce release onto the top of a tote from a defective bung cap. Upon further investigation, the contractor determined that the seal on the cap was damaged along with the threads. They replaced the cap and performed a slosh test. The tote passed and will ship on to the Consignee. No waste was generated from the incident. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were involved.

item.title: Report E-2025020110
item.description:
Report E-2025020110

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor and three other pails. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. Another one (1) 5-gallon metal drum was also used to contain the impacted pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025010078
item.description:
Report I-2025010078

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 7:34 PM on 01/18/25 oit was reported that tank car CGTX 31196 was leaking when the car was moved, the car was isolated in our track 48 at North Yard until we could contact the shipper. The shipper was contacted on 01/19/25 and requested we use pur Haz-Mat Contractor Haz-Mat Special Services to repair and clean. They determined that the swing bolts were not tightened properly resulting the leak, they corrected the issues and cleaned the car.

item.title: Report E-2025020129
item.description:
Report E-2025020129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal ULA experienced a release of UN1830 AcidPro S93 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product spilled due to a pallet nail puncture. The material impacted a 25' x 8' area of the trailer floor, and the concrete lot below in areas measuring 25' x 7 and 30' x 20'. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, neutralizer, pallet pieces, PPE, impacted debris, and the damaged original drum were collected and containerized into (11) poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 17:32 EST, ERTS XPO Logistics (UPO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 2 ounces of Foam Solvent Base Adhesive (hazardous - UN1133) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the container and did not impact the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged container will be placed into a 50-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Charlie (Chemtrec) who provided report #2024011000151.

  • Description: At approximately 8:00 PM on 01/09/25 our switch crew reported an odor while switch with car CCBX 2430, at the time of the report it was raining heavily and no leak could be detected, the car was isolated in our track 1 at North Yard until we could inspect this morning on 01/10/25 when it quit raining. A small amount of product was detected on the side of the car under the platform grating as was as along the lip of the Multi-Housing Nozzle and cover. The shipper Dow/R&H was notified and dispatched SRS along with their plant personnel to inspect the car and reported that the O-Ring on the magnetic gauge device had broken in two and that is what caused the release. The O-Ring was replaced and the car was cleaned of any residue.

No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Hepaco was dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up. Upon arrival Hepaco reported the team found the cause of the spill. It was a bung cap that fell out of the tote. Any product that leaked had already dried. The team replaced and secured the tote. All onsite was complete with no waste generated. The team departed the site.

item.title: Report I-2025010082
item.description:
Report I-2025010082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: San Jose
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After the meal service I heard yelling and screaming and upon standing I saw sparks and flames shooting into the air over seat 1 F in all directions. The pax in 1 F was charging her iPhone with her own Anker power bank which apparently exploded into flames and sparks in her lap. She stood up and the power bank was on the carpet in front of the seat in flames and shooting sparks. I immediately notified the cockpit and crew and donned the PBE and used the halon in F class to extinguish the flames. The battery continued to smolder and hiss. The#2 brought up the containment bag and other halons and eq and I placed the smoldering device in the bag following the procedures on the bag. 8L of water were used. The cord was burned as well as the pax blouse and napkin. The passenger's left hand was burned as well her wrist. The#2 applied the burn gel and I bandaged her hand and wrist. Blistering was appearing on her wrist and pax requested and was given a small bag of ice as well. Pax denied medical assistance on the ground but plane was met by medics staff and Pax went with them. Bag was contained in an empty cart in F class and monitored for the flight. No further incidence was noted. Pax took her own anti inflammatory medicine and stated she was staying in SJO with 2 doctors. Battery was an Anker power bank 10,000. It was not plugged into the seat but was plugged into and changing her phone inflight. Pax thanked the crew profusely for our quick handling of the situation. Smoke filled the cabin but dissipated within about 30 minutes. The smell in F class remained however. Several passengers were coughing and had burning eyes as a result. Crew seems ok. I sustained slight bums on right and left hand from the sparks and have a sore throat and burning eyes.

item.title: Report I-2025010012
item.description:
Report I-2025010012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While travelling, a vehicle accident caused truck to overturn off Highway 55 southbound just before Exit 40 in Independence, Louisiana. As a result, the freight shifted inside trailer, which resulted in the loss of less than 10 gallons of Nitromethane. The Louisiana State Police and Local Fire Department responded to assess the site. Clean Harbors Environmental Services was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, a minimal amount of free product was detected on the ground surface, which had been contained to immediate area. Gaines Wrecker Service uprighted the intermodal container /trailer and shipment was repositioned inside trailer for transport off Highway 55 to secure location nearby for transload. Louisiana State Police escorted Gaines Wrecker Service, along with recovered trailer, to 12392 LA 40 in Independence, Louisiana for transload. Clean Harbors Environmental Services recovered spent boom and absorbent material used to contain beneath overturned trailer, and hand shoveled a minimal amount of impacted soil from the area. Three 55- gallon drums of spent absorbents, boom, contaminated soil, and cleanup debris were generated during cleanup efforts. Clean Harbors Environmental Services then proceeded to transload the damaged drums onto a recovery trailer for transport to Gaines Wrecker Service at 12330 Louisiana Avenue in Roseland, Louisiana. Upon arrival at Gaines Wrecker Service, Clean Harbors Environmental Services overpacked the damaged drums, which were loaded back onto the recovery trailer, pending disposition. The shipment contained eighty (80) 55-gallon drums, of which eight (8) 55-gallon drums were discovered leaking from broken seams/pinhole cracks. The entire shipment had been damaged, and all eighty 55-gallon drums, were overpacked to prevent further incident.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 6, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the sites and containerized all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020096
item.description:
Report E-2025020096

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: COLOGNE
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO GERMANY WAS FOUND SOILED WITH A VERY STRONG ODOR. THE PACKAGE HAS AN EXCEPTED QUANTITY MARK APPLIED TO THE PACKAGE WITH CLASSES INDICATED AS 3, 4.1, 6.1, 8, AND 9. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS MULTIPLE GLASS BOTTLES INSIDE WITH SEVERAL SHATTERED AND LEAKING. SEVEN GLASS BOTTLES ARE 500 ML SIZE EACH. SIXTEEN GLASS BOTTLES ARE 30 ML EACH. THE REGULATED CONTENTS INSIDE THE BOX ARE EXCEPTED QUANTITIES OF MATERIALS CLASSIFIED AS UN2874, FURFURYL ALCOHOL, 6.1, PG III, UN3265 CORROSIVE LIQUID ACIDIC ORGANOS NOS, CLASS 8, PG III, UN1224 KETONES LIQUID NOS, CLASS 3, PG III, UN1325 FLAMMABLE SOLIDS ORGANIC NOS, CLASS 4.1, PG III, AND UN1197 EXTRACTS FLAVORING LIQUID, CLASS 3, PG II. THERE ARE ADDITIONAL CHEMICALS INSIDE THE BOX THAT ARE NOT REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS WILL BE DISPOSED OF.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all spent product. All debris was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were placed in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training & Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized cleaning agent, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum.

  • City: TUSTIN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 29, 2025, a Veolia employee was loading drums into a trailer at Eurofins. The employee used a drum dolly to move the 55 gallon plastic drum into the trailer. Once the employee placed the drum dolly down, the side of the drum cracked and started to spill. Approximately 2 gallons of liquid spilled from the drum. The drum was immediately leaned on its side to prevent additional liquid from spilling. A pump was used to transfer the contents of the leaking drum into a new drum for transportation. The spill was cleaned with absorbent.

  • Description: Driver stated he had finished unloading, closed all valves including the trailer's internal valve and disconnected the unloading hose. While attempting to replace the protective cap on the outlet fitting, the Driver states he either slipped and reached out for something(valve) to "catch " himself or the cap's safety chain(cable) became draped over the valve handle and when he pulled the cap the valve opened slightly. Residual product exited the outlet contacting the driver in the mid section. There was no failure of packaging, valves or equipment.

  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified of a lithium battery overheat event during flight of DL771/27Dec2024 (JFK-LAX). A passenger's power bank overheated resulting in a fire. A responding Flight Attendant was able to contain the fire using water. The Fire Department was called and put the item in the lithium-ion containment bag. A passenger's hand was burned but declined medical assistance. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report I-2025010054
item.description:
Report I-2025010054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T00:57:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pax had spare lithium battery inside a pouch filled with pens and stickers. According to FA battery started to smoke and release a funky smell. Open opening they noticed that a camera battery had started expanding. Battery melt and charred some of the things that was around it. Appears one of the 3 batteries inside pouch started to smoke. It did char and melt some of the surrounding items. Was put inside BCB. After a thorough debrief with the flight attendants and the passenger involved, it appears the passenger was attempting to improvise a point-and-shopt style camera battery with wires and electrical tape to charge her iPod. Our passenger(seated in 32A) with the battery problem alerted the FA B & C after she noticed smoke and an electrical smell coming from the small fabric purse they were in. She reportedly leapt over her seat mates with the bag and brought it back to the aft galley and said something to the effect of "l have a battery fire in my bag." According to the flight attendants, the small amount of smoke and fumes that were present in the cabin quickly dissipated. 15 photos sent to FAA hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2025020052
item.description:
Report E-2025020052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding damaged plastic bags of hazardous product, ABF-004. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1lb release from two bags onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4 x 4 area and the concrete dock floor in a 2x2 area as a result of improper loading. The contractor cleaned-up the release using a HEPA vac. Two 55-gallon DFs containing the damaged bags of product, impacted PPE, and impacted plastic were generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025020080
item.description:
Report E-2025020080

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: KARLSRUHE-GROTZ
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE KARLSRUHE CENTER IN GERMANY ONE FULLY DECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE ARRIVED WITH EVIDENCE OF HAVNG UNDERGONE A PREVIOUS LITHIUM BATTERY THERMAL EVENT. THE OUTER BOX HAS SEVERAL VISIBLE PUNCTURE HOLES WITH EVIDENCE OF CHARRING. AT THE TIME OF DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS NOT WARM AND WAS NOT IN AN ACTIVE THERMAL EVENT. UPON CONTENT INSPECTION, TWO LITHIUM ION BATTERIES HAVE A BURN APPEARANCE ON THEIR METAL POLES WITH SLIGHT CHARRING AROUND THE POLES. THE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY POLES HAVE PUNCTURED THROUGH TO THE OUTER BOX. THE OUTER BOX IS UN SPECIFICAITON PACKAGING 4G/Y30/S/24/SGP/SCL 033. THE OUTER BOX HAS APPROPRIATE DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS AND LABELS WITH A DANGEROUS GOODS UPS ACCEPTED STICKER HAVING PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN HONG KONG. A TELEPHONE REPORT WAS VERBALLY MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER AS REQUIRED PER 171.15 ON 05-FEBRUARY-2025 UNDER NRC 1422799.

  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH A PERISHABLE KEEP FROZEN STICKER AFFIXED TO THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SIX POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. INNER FLAP HAD A STICKER STATING DANGER-DRY ICE USE PROTECTIVE GLOVES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1V820A, VANDEMOORTELE, 1005 MAIN ST, PAWTUCKET RI 02860-7802.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a damaged PAIL containing hazardous product, ZEP morado super cleaner. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 3x3 area and the contractor beneath the trailer in a 10x3 area. One PAIL was damaged as a result of improper loading releasing its entire contents. The contractor neutralized and cleaned the release using water and absorbents. One 55-gallon DF was generated containing the damaged pail of product, granular absorbents, shrink wrap, and pallet pieces. XPO will manage all the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this release.

THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY.

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: PATERSON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 31, 2025 a package was found during the PM sort that had started emitting smoke and heat. The package contained UN3480, Lithium Ion Batteries, 9. The package was immediately doused with water and an extinguisher was used to put out the flames and stop the evolution of heat, preventing more thermal runaway. The package was then isolated and is being held. FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration attempted to follow the process and report this to the NRC, however the person at the NRC, Mr. Archibald, who answered the call refused to take the report due to the incident not happening on an aircraft or American soil.

  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding leaking bags containing hazardous product, ABF-004. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5lbs of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2x2 area as a result of dunnage due to improper loading. The contractor cleaned up the release and loose-packed the three damaged bags into one 55-gallon DF. The remaining intact freight was re-palletized and will ship onto the Consignee. Impacted cardboard and pallet pieces were containerized into two additional 55-gallon DFs for waste disposal XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025020198
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD B. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON EACH OF THE INNER 1 GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

  • Description: EXPORT DOCUMENTS FOR ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM TN, USA TO US VIRGIN ISLANDS WAS INSPECTED. THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBES CONTENTS AS AGM BATTERY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE D5100R NON-SPILLABLE LEAD ACID BATTERY INSIDE THE PACKAGE. INVOICE AND PACKING SLIP INDICATE A BATTERY IS BEING SHIPPED. THE BOX HAS TWO PACKING LIST ENCLOSED POUCHES APPLIED WITH THE LETTERS "AGM NON-" VISIBLE NEXT TO ONE OF THE POUCHES. THERE ARE NO VISIBLE DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY. THE INNER BOX HOLDING THE BATTERY DOES INDICATE CONTENTS AS D5100R 12V AGM POWERCELL SEALED NON-SPILLABLE LEAD ACID BATTERY. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THERE, THE SORTER, NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. SHE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUBE. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. AEROSOLS, FLAMMABLE. INNER BOX MARKED WITH LTD QTY MARKING

  • City: SAINT LOUIS

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0830 ET, XPO-XSL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 pint of Express alkali released from a plastic tote due to improper loading The release impacted inside trailer#. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined contractors' assistance would be necessary due to its haz class 8 corrosive and a tote Transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of UN1824 Express Alkali product released to a 28 x 8 area of the trailer floor due to a pallet of metal beams had tipped over and punctured the side of the tote. The crew performed a tote transfer and cleaned the impacted trailer floor using Simple Green, granular absorbent pads. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents into (2) 55- gallon poly drums, (2) 55 poly drum contains oil dri, (1) 55-poly drum contains product only. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While seated, the passenger in 20A went to the back and told the FAs that her phone smelled. The flight attendants then went to 20A, where they could smell something burning. No flames or smoke were seen. No passengers around or flight attendants reported irritation or feeling sick. The flight attendants reported that the charging brick and charging cable were warm and smelled like something was burning. The phone was turned off, and the charger was unplugged from the outlet immediately. Once it was unplugged, the smell went away. The flight attendants also said the passenger's phone would not charge and that the charging cable was damaged but had no exposed wires. Item placed in TCB for remainder of flight.

item.title: Report E-2025010097
item.description:
Report E-2025010097

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/08/2025, at 1215 hours, personnel in the CSXT Spartanburg Yard discovered CELX 206, a loaded tank car of Ethylene, refrigerated liquid, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Celanese, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-01-08-00139. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the internal pressure of the tank car was at 74 psi and intermittingly venting. Marion Environmental Inc was additionally dispatched to the scene to conduct a flaring operation to reduce internal pressure off from the tank car. The vacuum was obtained from CELX 206 with a reading of 1300-1500 microns which is an indication that the tank car was over pressurizing. The excess pressure was flared off to 46 psi. CELX 206 was then moved to Celanese industry in Enoree SC without any further issues. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shippers representative (Sam Adkins, 304-638-3138).

  • Description: At 06:57 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UBY) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper packaging, approximately 1 gallon of Sodium Hydroxide - Nu-Brite Cleaner (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #85. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN3266 Sodium Hydroxide product released to a 6 x 6 area of the trailer floor and a 4x4 area on the wall of the trailer due to the cap of the tote popping off. The top was replaced, and it was ensured it was seated properly. Sodium Bicarbonate solution was used to neutralize the impacted areas. Contractors containerized impacted rags, PPE and poly sheeting into (1) 55-gallon poly. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On January 03, 2025, A Duie Pyle notified Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a cargo release in East Brunswick, NJ. It was reported that approximately 300 gallons of UN1170 Ethanol released from a metal tote due to improper handling. The release impacted the inside of a trailer and asphalt. No storm drains or waterways were impacted. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up. Upon arrival CH reported the team inspected the tote to find it was knocked over and the lid popped off. CH reported they moved the tote upright and placed the lid back on. The team then began to work in absorbents. All clean up was completed creating eleven 55-gallon drums of impacted absorbents. All waste was taken off-site for proper disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver connected the Consignee's hose that leads into the storage tank. He noticed the hose gasket did not look good and replaced the gasket. There were no issues initially with the unload. The driver the unload area unattended to use the restroom. Upon returning to the trailer, the hose was leaking at the location of the replaced gasket. 200 gallons of product released. The Release impacted an area of 5X50 on concrete and asphalt. No soil or drains were impacted. Area was pressure-washed and the water was collected for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025010018
item.description:
Report I-2025010018

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: DANDRIDGE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Medical Delivery Services
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 11 :00 am ET on December 11, PETNET Knoxville-UT was notified that an MDS courier transporting three PETNET cases containing live patient doses had been involved in a single-vehicle rollover accident on eastbound Interstate 40 near mile marker 424. The bills of lading for those packages are in Attachment 1. The cases contained a total of five patient doses with a combined activity of approximately 210 mCi of Flourine-18 at the time of the accident, and were being delivered to Haywood Regional Medical Center in Clyde, NC. Although the delivery vehicle appeared to have rolled over several times, no cases were ejected. However, a hazmat team responded to the scene and closed the eastbound lanes of the interstate for several hours. Corporate Health Physicist Chris Walters made phone contact with Chief Lee Turner, who was on the scene of the accident, at approximately 11 :40 am to assess the situation. As a result of that conversation, he requested an on-site visit from the corporate Radiation Protection team. Chief Turner relayed that he had also alerted the TN Division of Radiological Health. At approximately 1:00 PM, Corporate Radiation Safety Officer Elizabeth Gillenwalters and Health Physicist Chris Hile arrived at the scene of the accident. Using a Ludlum 44-9 pancake probe with a Model 3 Meter and a Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker, very careful surveys of the vehicle, one officer's clothing that had been reported as possibly contaminated, and the surrounding area were performed. No results greater than background were identified in any areas or materials surveyed. The officer's clothing items were left at the scene. All three delivery cases were still intact with the security zip tie still in place. Each case was thoroughly wiped on the outside, and the wipes surveyed with the Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker. No results greater than background were identified, verifying no material had left containment. The cases were loaded into our vehicle and returned them to the PETNET UT Knoxville facility, located within the UT Medical Center. Additional photos of the packages and the scene are included in Attachments 2 and 3, respectively.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 100-gallons of diesel fuel was released from a tanker filling up the underground tank due to a possible overfill. The release impacted asphalt, concrete and snow. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Baranko Bros deployed absorbents throughout the impacted areas. Baranko Bros confirmed the material has affected the soil and rock area, with diesel pooling beneath the rocks. Baranko Bros used a sweeper to work on the oil dry that was deployed. Additional remediation is scheduled for spring 2025, when temperatures rise.

item.title: Report E-2024120272
item.description:
Report E-2024120272

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-07T00:48:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: MOSHEIM
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Holston Gases, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 127250
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver had been making propane deliveries during the remnants of Hurricane Helene. Weather conditions were rainy with very high gusty winds. Driver stated that heavy wind gust caught the truck and pushed the truck toward the shoulder of the roadway. Right side tires dropped off the asphalt and when the driver corrected truck proceeded to overturn in the roadway and rolled coming to a stop on its side. Impact from the rollover damage one of the vapor return valves on the back of the truck and it started leaking propane. Area was secured when law enforcement arrived at the scene. Roadway was closed due to leaking propane. Fire Department and Greenville TN Hazmat team also responded to the site. Response team connected a vapor hose to the truck and routed it away from the truck so that vapor could be flared off to reduce the vapor pressure in the tank. Once the vapor pressure the was reduced the leak subsequently stopped so that the truck could be returned to its wheels and towed from the site.
